What types of fish do you have, how many do you have, and, if they have names, what are they?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Town Hall (Polls): Polls on Other Subjects: What types of fish do you have, how many do you have, and, if they have names, what are they?
By Nicole on Friday, July 30, 2004 - 09:28 pm:

In the 55-gallon aqaurium:
I have four angelfish, named Meanie, The Thing, Black Eye, and Spot. I also have one of those see-through fish named Sea-Through-It, two fish that are pinkish-white with clear fins named Fish A and Fish B (Fish B is overweight, which is how I tell them apart), and a bottomfeeder named Bottomdweller.

In the fishbowl:
A dark blue, silver-faced Betta fish named Shark.

By King Bunny on Saturday, July 31, 2004 - 09:33 am:

I don't have any yet in my 35 gallon tank... but, I will in like two weeks. This is what I'm planning on (can't decide between these two). I don't name fish, never have, and most likely never will.

A plant heavy tank, with lots of rocks, driftwood, and caves with these fish
(community tank):
6 Danios (not Giant or Long Finned) [starter]
6 Neon Tetras
6 Harlequin Rasbora / Threadfin Rainbow
6 Panda Cory Catfish
1 Betta
10 Ghost Shrimp

or

A moderately planted tank, driftwood, rocks, and few caves, with some open area for the Barbs
(semi-aggressive tank):
6 Tiger Barb [starter]
3 Yo Yo Loach (evil Infernus)
1 Flying Fox

By Anonymous on Sunday, August 1, 2004 - 06:59 am:

My sister used to have a fishbowl with a goldfish. Then it died, so she got a beta and a cleaner snail. Then the Beta died and she got another. Then the shrimp died, but she didn't know it, and the lack of clean water killed the beta. Then she got a ten gallon tank with two reject goldfish from one of those carnie games where you toss a pingpong ball into a bowl to get a fish as a prize. The first one died, and in consideration with her record, she gave the second one away. In keeping with her lack of pets, just as a note, her finch {little parakeet-like bird} had a seizure.

By Nicole on Thursday, September 9, 2004 - 12:21 pm:

Bottomdweller died...I got two new fish! A Rubberlips named Big Mouth and a little black-and-white catfish named Whiskers. I call them 'The Maintenence Men' because Big Mouth eats algae (ONLY algae) and Whiskers eats fish food that falls to the bottom and...droppings.

By Nicole on Friday, September 24, 2004 - 04:12 pm:

By King Bunny on Saturday, September 25, 2004 - 08:52 am:

Nicole, seeing how often you've had fish die, I suggest you do some research on the Nitrogen cycle, as well as researching the fish you have.

Some good sites to start at are fishindex.com, aquariumfish.net, and google.com.

By King Bunny on Saturday, October 2, 2004 - 03:21 pm:

I just bought a a beautiful three inch Red Tailed Black shark on impulse. I'm BAAAAD!

By Nicole on Wednesday, November 3, 2004 - 03:02 pm:

New fish! I have all kinds of info on her type, but I forgot the species name! She has special markings that only females of her type (And if I remember right, she's some sort of gourami - but maybe not) - a silverish color with two black spots on each side. Her name is Neonsky.

By Ace of Spades on Tuesday, November 16, 2004 - 05:40 pm:

I had over eight guppies, and about 48 to 60 somthing fry... that is, until my lil sister got her boyfriend mad who then (being the *censored* he is) turned up the heat in my guppy tank. He thought it was hers... I finally noticed that they were all floating around upside down when I got home from hockey practice. Mmm mmm mmm, good 'ol fried guppy. After the death of the adults, the (almost) entire population of my smaller fry tank fell to about 4, and the next day to 2.

While cleaning out the adult tank, I found another baby!

Today I now have 3 adult guppys (2 males and 1 female) and 2 fry... at least for now. (now i check my sister's boyfriends for signs of insanity and the like)

By Ace of Spades on Tuesday, November 16, 2004 - 05:41 pm:

Forgot to say that the tank water was over 99 degrees. I was lucky the tank didn't burst...
